body.name: InnoGear Mic Boom Arm Microphone Stand Cable Management for Blue Yeti HyperX QuadCast S SoloCast AT2020 Shure SM7B MV7 Fifine K669B AM8 and Other Microphone
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 17. Order within 4 hrs 12 mins
features: Cable Management Channels: The upgraded mic arms are optimized with built-in channels as cable management for you to put your cables in by simply removing the rubber cable covers, bringing a clean and neat look without getting your setups and cables tangled while recording or live streaming. The thoughtful design frees the whole look of being a mess and provides a shelter for cables.

Adjustable Angle & Smooth Movement: The boom arm is fully adjustable in 135° back and forth, and 180° up and down, easy to adjust in multiple directions silently. The base is 360° rotatable. This flexible arm stand allows you to determine which angle is the best for your recording needs.

Upgraded Length & Height: The length of the arm is increased to 14 inches and the package comes with a 6.3 inches extension riser for extra height. This mic stand has a max reach of 32.3 inches horizontally and 37.4 inches vertically to extend over most monitors. The desk clamp can clip to any desk up to 2 inches thick.

Built-in Springs & Strong Stability: Made of high-grade thickened steel, this sturdy microphone stand features strong internal springs for reaching a max load-bearing capacity of 3.5 pounds. It can easily handle the weight of heavy microphones like Yeti and SM7B, staying where you put it.

Universal Compatibility: The 5/8" metal connector is compatible with different kinds of microphones like Blue Yeti, Hyper X QuadCast, SoloCast, Blue Snowball, Shure SM7B, Shure MV7, AT2020, AT2020USB+, AT2035, ATR2500-USB, ATR2100-USB, Fifine K669B (Shock mount not included), Fifine AM8, etc. Perfect for studio, recording, podcasting, streaming, stage.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: An Excellent Choice for Musicians. InnoGear Upgraded Mic Boom Arm Stand Featuring strong internal springs and hidden cable channels, this mic arm stand is made of high-quality steel for an outstanding bearing capacity of 3.5 lb. It is adjustable, durable, and easy to install. Its 5/8" metal thread adapter fits for Blue Yeti, Hyper X QuadCast, Snowball, AT2020, etc.

Cable Hiding Management This boom arm is designed with inner channels for storing and concealing your USB and XLR cables, creating a clean, sleek, and professional look. It is easy to detach the rubber cable covers to put in the cables. This cable management keeps you free from the mess of tangled cables and saves space. Strong Loading Capacity The max bearing capacity of this microphone stand is 3.5 lbs. It is heavy-duty and sturdy enough to hold most heavy microphones such as Blue Yeti, Shure SM7B and Shure MV7. You can move your microphone all around during your use without worrying that it is going to fall or shake.

Quality Made Stand Made of good quality steel, this mic stand is solid and durable to use, being a versatile configuration for both beginner and professional use. Adjustable Angle This arm stand is adjustable and flexible in all parts, enabling you to adjust the suitable angle and height to show your perfect voice. Stable Desk Clamp The table clamp is designed with a side screw to have the stand firmed tightly on the desk and the sponge pad could protect your desk from scratches. Extension Riser The package concludes one 6.3" detachable extension riser for extra height need. You can set the stand behind the monitor to save more desk space.

360° Rotation Angle Moves Smoothly and Silently The springs of the stand are all internal, bringing a stylish and neat look. This boom arm can keep your microphone stable when moving it around, and make no annoying moving sound in your recording or live streaming. Perfect for home studio, professional recording, podcasting, live streaming, etc.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent value for the price
reviews.reviewText: This isn't the best-made arm I've ever seen... but for the price, it's been pretty hard to beat. It serves my purposes perfectly. I'm using it with a FiFine mic, and I couldn't be happier with the performance from the pair.This keeps my mic completely out of my way until I need it, then it's ready to go at a moment's notice. The cord channels work perfectly and keep the USB cable neatly hidden away. Great buy for light duty and occasional use. If I was going to use it several times daily, I might look for something a bit sturdier, but for me, that would be overkill.The range of motion is fine for what it is... but this arm isn't quite as articulated as others. I knew that going in, and am willing to live with the limitation to get the price I wanted. But because of this, getting the arm positioned on my desk relative to my computer (which is a notebook mounted on another arm) so that I could easily use it took a bit of work, but once I got that figured out, it's worked great. NO complaints at all!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great, affordable mic arm
reviews.reviewText: Assembly was quick, and easy, I love how strong the joints are, my former mic arm could not withstand the weight of my mic, and dipped often, this one is holding it exactly where I want it. The only quip I have is that it wobbles a little, nothing severe, and it's almost expected, being so tall with only one point of security at the base, but it isn't so large amount of movement that I'm afraid for my equipment, more of a slight annoyance.Tldr; it's a great item for the price point and does it's job well. I would definitely purchase this again!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is a really well-made microphone arm, far better than the one I had previous. I especially like the cable managing sleeves that are included to hide the microphone cable.But this thing is just TOO stiff. I'm glad it's not flimsy, but when my entire desk flexes just trying to pull it towards my face that's almost an equal and opposite problem.I'm sure there's a way to loosen it up, but trying to do so myself produced less than helpful results. Either way still a great, functional arm. Just be wary that if you're desk is made of particle board you may just snap it in half trying to move this thing around.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Strong, Compact and Looks Good
reviews.reviewText: Been using this mic stand for a few weeks now. So far I like it. It is securely holding my RE20 Which is a heavy mic at 1.5 lbs. It extends far enough away from the desk I have it secured to. I like that I can fold it down and tuck it away when not in use. I like how it looks and that the mic cable can be hidden. I cannot comment on long term durability yet, but it seems well constructed and is adequately secured to my work desk.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars new streamer. This is sturdy and just what I needed
reviews.reviewText: I went through a few of these arm booms on amazon and those previous ones were dinky little things. (cost less as well) This one is sturdy, and stays locked in place once you position it. I can easily swing it left and right to get out of my way when I dont need it with a single finger.Vertical movement is locked in. It will 'rock' up and down if you put your hand on it and intentionally move it. When I do this it will move about an inch up or down, but when you're gaming/streaming and not touching it...it's not going to move. If you're looking for a good value arm this is it. I was considering the elgato boom arm, but why spend more money when this does exactly what I need it to do and it does it well? As a value shopper...this is it. If you need it to say elgato just get a marker and write 'elgato' on it. done.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This thing feels strong!
reviews.reviewText: Pretty impressed with this mic stand. Last one I got felt cheap and not built with any quality. We added an office to our workshop and I placed my second computer out there. Needed this to help work with the space a little better than my floor-stand type of mic holder.Love the way you can hide the wires into stand itself. Keeps it looking neat. I do a lot of video recording for content and this looks and works great with my setup. Fantastic purchase. Glad I wasn't cheap and got something else to save money. There is the possibility that I would buy a second one and update my home office with it. I will give this a long term test and see how much I like it. But so far, so good!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not compatible with Audio-Technica AT2020
reviews.reviewText: My main problem is the 5/8" adapter does not fit with the AT2020, and now I have to find screw adapters to make it work. This a huge headache.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect and affordable
reviews.reviewText: Looks great, sturdy, helps save some desk space, hides cords well, holds Yeti Blue well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Casi perfecto, pero no es compatible con el AT2035 como dice en el anuncio
reviews.reviewText: TLDR: necesitas un adaptador 5/8 a 1/4 si quieres utilizarlo con un AT2035 y su montura antichoques.El producto como tal tiene 5 estrellas. Es un brazo de acero que se nota va a durar mucho más que el que tenía. Anteriormente adquirí el paquete de Audio Technica 2035 con su brazo y me duró unos 4 años. Hace un par de días desafortunadamente se rompió y decidí comprar éste y vaya sorpresa. Es mucho más fuerte que el de AT y la calidad del material y las piezas es superior en todos los aspectos. El brazo no se mueve tan fácilmente pero precisamente eso estaba buscando. Es rígido y manipulable.Sin embargo, hubo un problema serio: la tuerca para enroscar el micrófono no es compatible pues es 5/8 y mi micrófono es 1/4. Me dejé llevar por el anuncio pues decía que era compatible con el AT2035 (y además en la imágen dice que la rosca 5/8 es un "adaptador" y supuse que se podía quitar para dejarla 1/4) pero no lo es. Desafortunadamente me vi obligado a comprar un adaptador 5/8 a 1/4 adicional y tomará otro par de días hasta que pueda utilizar mi micrófono.Revisa bien que tu micrófono sea 5/8 y no 1/4 como es el estándard para que puedas utilizarlo. Esa es la única razón por la que no le doy 5 estrellas. Si no tienes este problema, es el mejor brazo que puedes comprar a este precio.
